message: Sharing a special moment with my family before I am sworn into the 115th Congress!

The Affordable Care Act helped Texas bring down its uninsured rate 28%. Repealing the ACA without a replacement will leave 20-30 million Americans without access to healthcare and #MakeAmericaSickAgain. The @congressionalblackcaucus will fight for all those who know access to healthcare should be affordable and accessible.
#ThanksObama for eight years of representing our country with dignity, grace, and bravery. We are a better country for it. #ObamaFarewell

Despite House Republicans threat to repeal the Affordable Care Act, we know that the ACA helped over 1.7 million Texans gain access to health insurance. Join me this Saturday, Jan. 14th in Fort Worth at 1325 S. Main Street to enroll and ensure you have healthcare coverage for the coming year.
The Affordable Care Act has made health coverage affordable for millions of Americans. How has the #ACA worked for you? Share your story of how the #ACAworks for you in the comments below.

The Affordable Care Act has given every American—regardless of age, gender, employment status, pre-existing condition or race—the ability to get quality, affordable health insurance. Unfortunately, a repeal of the Affordable Care Act without replacement will affect millions of Americans. Today, I am proud to join JPS Health Network, an organization that has fought alongside Democrats to ensure that health care is a right and not a privilege. #CoverageMatters

Today as we commemorate the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., we are reminded of how far we’ve come as a nation and the work that remains.  During the Civil Rights era, Dr. King’s words and actions changed the nation as he led the charge against hatred, bigotry, and intolerance. We continue to draw strength from his wisdom as we continue our march towards ensuring equality for all Americans no matter your race, gender, or creed. His message of unity and peace especially resonates today as we work to bring our country together to tackle the challenges that lie ahead. #MLKDay

Starting off the morning with a tour and a brief history lesson from Steve Smith, Historian of the Army & Air Force Exchange Service headquarters in Dallas for today's 'Marc Means Business' work day. #ExchangeAssoc #FamilyServingFamily #MMB
First task of the day, picking up a shift at the Starbucks located in the #Exchange Food Court. #MMB #ExchangeAssoc #FamilyServingFamily

Next up, working in the Quality Assurance Lab at the #Exchange. It's critical to ensure the clothing passes the appearance test and meets #exchange standards in order for a product to make it onto the sales floor. #MMB #ExchangeAssoc #FamilyServingFamily
Next task, restocking the shelves at The Express Store alongside Allison Cook. She's a Reservist, Captain, and Company Commander in the National Guard.  #MMB #ExchangeAssoc #FamilyServingFamily

Happy to provide a helping hand back at the Food Court. I had the pleasure of getting guidance from Ms. Carolyn Dixon who's worked at the Burger King at the #Exchange for 15 years!  #MMB #ExchangeAssoc #FamilyServingFamily

The #Exchange prides itself in the great customer service they provide. That's why I was paired with Danielle Frazee, a Customer Contact Tech, at the Call Center to learn how the #Exchange keeps its superb reputation. #MMB

During my quick lunch break, I had the opportunity to meet with three of my constituents who work at the #Exchange headquarters. (L-R) Candice Sims, Trish Durham, and Marie Rives. #MMB #ExchangeAssoc #FamilyServingFamily

House Democrats and I refuse to stand by and watch as the GOP’s #MakeAmericaSickAgain agenda threatens the health of 32 MILLION Americans. There are many ways that we can strengthen American families – but repealing the ACA is not one of them.

As a native Texan, I know firsthand that a healthy relationship between the U.S. and Mexico means for a stronger economy. Join me and my colleagues as we discuss why "Border Business is America's Business."  #BorderBiz

Join me & Special Guests Rep. Linda Sánchez and Consul General of Mexico Francisco de la Torre, and expert panelists at this Saturday's #DACA Summit and Immigration Town Hall to discuss the uncertain days ahead for the immigrant community under the Trump Administration.  Come listen and share how President Obama’s Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program (DACA)  has changed the life of thousands of young aspiring Americans, explain your rights under DACA, and show the economic toll repeal of #DACA would take on Texas and the rest of the country. Details & RSVP: https://www.facebook.com/events/1715573218754255/

Fort Worth, Texas-Join me TOMORROW  for my next Coffee with Your Congressman at Esperanza’s Bakery and Café on North Main Street. Come grab a cup of coffee & share your thoughts on what I can do in Washington for YOU and your family.

Did you know that if President Trump does indeed remove Texas' 120,000 #DACA recipients from the workforce, the Texas economy would lose $6.1 billion annually? Read more details in my The Dallas Morning News Op-Ed piece,"If DACA immigration program ends, Texas will lose" and I hope you will join me for my #DACA Summit & Immigration Town Hall THIS SATURDAY at Kidd Springs Recreation Center with special guests Rep. Linda Sánchez and Consul General of Mexico Francisco de la Torre.  http://www.dallasnews.com/opinion/commentary/2017/01/16/daca-immigration-program-ends-texas-will-lose

The truth is, President Trump’s twitter rant about #voterfraud and his call for major investigation are no more than his own self-delusion and insecurity over losing the popular vote. I know firsthand how #Texas - and other states who use phony voter fraud claims -  justify voter suppression and #discrimination. Read how in my Op-Ed piece in The Hill: http://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/politics/316571-texas-is-ground-zero-for-baseless-voter-fraud-claims

We’ve settled into our new Fort Worth office! Come join me and my staff Saturday, February 11th from 9:00 AM–10:30 AM for an open house where you can check out the new office, ask questions, and learn about the services our office can provide you. A FREE breakfast will be served as well.  RSVP: https://www.facebook.com/events/1250410388375814/

Each year our country dedicates the month of February to the celebration and recognition of the African American community’s rich history and current contributions. Every day African American community members both in and out of #TX33 are working to improve this great nation. As we begin Black History Month, we must not only recognize their contributions and achievements but also continue working to ensure equality for all. #BlackHistoryMonth

Come celebrate the opening of my new Fort Worth Office on Saturday, February 11 from 9-10:30 AM! This is your chance to check out the new office, meet my staff, and join me a for FREE breakfast. To RSVP, please visit my event page: http://bit.ly/2kAEFyZ. I hope to see you next week!
Congratulations to Brandon Long, Helsey Azua, and Mark Wright for being selected as TX-33's service academies nominees! I wish you the best of luck as you take the first step in serving our country.

Have you RSVP'd yet for the open house at my new Fort Worth Office this Saturday? Don't worry, there's still time to join me. For event information please click here: http://bit.ly/2kAEFyZ. I hope to see you all there!
ICYMI: POLITICO's Isaac Dovere sat down with myself and  Congressman Brendan Boyle to talk about our newly formed Blue Collar Caucus. Check it out: http://politi.co/2k4ADLm

Tune-in here in just a few minutes as we go LIVE for my panel discussion in observation of Black History Month entitled, “Closing the Gap: African Americans in Energy.” #Energy Committee on Science, Space, & Technology - Democrats

In honor of Black History Month, I'm hosting "Bridge the Gap: African Americans in Energy" to hear from expert panelists about the challenges Africans Americans face in the energy sector and how public policy can help increase diversity in this crucial field.

During the Committee on Science, Space, & Technology - Democrats hearing, I presided as Ranking Member as we reviewed the merits of Dept. of Energy Loan Programs. These programs have something for everybody: investments in renewables, nuclear, and fossil energy, and they even reduce our national debt. You can watch me speak here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zKrVXoYCQ8E&t=1579

Congratulations to City of Irving, Texas - City Hall and Fort Worth City Hall (City of Fort Worth) who were recognized today in D.C. for their innovative use of Community Development Block Grants by the National Community Development Association. #MakingNorthTexasProud

Join me THIS Friday, February 24 from 7:30 AM-9 AM for my next Coffee with Your Congressman. I'll be at Tia Dora's Bakery & Cafe located at 2478 W. Illinois Avenue in Dallas, Texas. This is your opportunity to share your thoughts on how I can best represent you in Congress. I look forward to seeing you!

Joining the KEMP & SONS General Services team for my 'Marc Means Business' work day this morning! We're rolling up our sleeves to keep the VA Outpatient Clinic in Fort Worth, Texas spotless. #MMB #TX33 #FortWorth
Teamwork makes the job easier! Next task, cleaning the offices. #MMB #TX33 #FortWorth

Good Morning! I hope to see many of you in just a few minutes at Tia Dora's Bakery & Cafe in Dallas, Texas for my next Coffee with Your Congressman! This is your opportunity to meet with me and share your thoughts on how I can best represent you in Congress.

During the month of February, we celebrate Black History Month.Together, we take the time to highlight the diverse voices of the African American community and their contributions to our nation’s history.
Wishing my friend, Pastor Overseer Bowman, a happy 60th birthday!

Joining me this evening for the #JointSession is Bothina Matar, a Syrian refugee who resettled in  Dallas, Texas in 2015. Before the joint session, Bothina and her husband Tamam Al Sharaa will share their thoughts on President Trump’s restrictive immigration policies and detail the positive contributions refugees make in their adopted homes. Their story serves as an example of how the United States is a welcoming country with a diverse society and our resettlement program continues to reflect this. You can learn more about their long journey here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M7BF9qkQpa8

I shared a small gift with my joint session guests, Bothina and Tamam Al Sharaa to take back to their children in Dallas after they leave D.C. tomorrow. As a father myself, I can only imagine the difficult decisions Bothina and Tamam faced as they fled their home country of Syria, lived in a Jordanian refugee camp for two years, then 18 months later finally resettled in Dallas. Our country can continue to provide refuge for the world's most vulnerable while keeping the United States safe. #RefugeesWelcome

After years of claiming to be on the cusp of unveiling a better healthcare plan than the Affordable Care Act, House Republicans big healthcare reveal proves to be all smoke and mirrors.   The Republican plan will make sure that healthcare coverage will only be available to a privileged few. For millions of hardworking Americans, the new plan would raise healthcare costs while providing less coverage. For our nation’s seniors, House Republicans are handing the reigns back to insurance companies to once again charge the elderly a higher rate for healthcare. For our nation’s children and working poor, House Republicans are cutting off Medicaid expansion, a vital lifeline for our most vulnerable populations to receive the most basic health care needs. For Americans with a pre-existing condition, House Republicans leave them vulnerable to insurance companies that wish to deny them coverage.  It is clear that Republicans are quickly trying to pass a poorly written bill without showing how many millions of Americans will be at risk of losing coverage under their replacement plan. The American people have made it clear, that they want quality healthcare that is both affordable and available when they need it.  If we want to provide stability for hardworking families, gutting current healthcare protections and raising premiums for lower quality healthcare coverage cannot be the route we take.

During my time in Congress, I have met with community stakeholders, industry and business leaders, faith leaders, workforce advocates, refugees, DREAMers, and their parents who all share our hopes and dreams of securing a good life while contributing faithfully to our country. Immigrants are just like us. We all know where the President stands on #immigration. He uses fearmongering to paint an untrue picture of the many contributions immigrants make to our great nation. He implemented a discriminatory and mean-spirited Muslim ban. He’s separating families in our communities. That's why I will continue to be a voice for the voiceless and continue the fight for true comprehensive immigration reform. #NoBanNoWall

In celebration of #InternationalWomensDay and a #DayWithoutAWoman, I was proud to stand alongside my colleagues as House Democrats work to ensure equal pay for equal work, fight for women’s access to reproductive healthcare, secure affordable childcare, and to recognize women’s rights as human rights.
Earlier this week, I paid a heartfelt tribute to the life and memory of Pastor Nehemiah Davis, who served the Mount Pisgah Missionary Baptist Church and the Fort Worth, Texas community for decades.

It was an honor to host such a courageous couple as my Joint Session guests. I was moved by the fact that despite all the hardships Bothina Matar and her family faced, she remained hopeful and looked to the future. Despite President Trump's continued demonization of refugees, I'll continue to fight to ensure that the most vulnerable are welcomed into the American family. #RefugeesWelcome #NoBanNoWall

The House Republican health care plan will provide less coverage, offer fewer protections, and increase costs for hardworking Americans. Tune in right here in just a few moments as I'll be LIVE chatting about how the House Republican plan will #MakeAmericaSickAgain.   But I don’t want to just tell you why I oppose this plan. I want to hear from YOU! Visit ResistRepeal.org to tell House Democrats how you feel about the legislation.
The American Healthcare Act is a bad deal for hardworking Americans. Healthcare is a right, not a privilege for the wealthy few. #ProtectOurCare

After a six-year long court battle, I am proud to announce that we are one step closer to restoring the voices of thousands of otherwise disenfranchised Texas voters. The recent ruling by a panel of federal judges concluded that the Republican state legislature’s 2011 congressional maps were drawn to intentionally discriminate against minority voters and actively dilute their voting power.  While the creation of the congressional district I currently represent may have resolved some of the court’s issues with the 2011 maps, this monumental decision will ensure that African-American and Hispanic voters in the DFW Metroplex and throughout Texas are accurately protected at the ballot box for years to come. Voters must have the ability choose their representatives, not vice versa. Last night’s court decision is the first step in ensuring that Texas Latino and African American voters' constitutional right to electoral representation is preserved.  http://www.star-telegram.com/news/politics-government/state-politics/article137933288.html
Thank you to the Dallas Regional Chamber, Young Professionals - Dallas Regional Chamber and #TX33 for joining Congressman Eric Swalwell and I at our first #FutureForum event this morning!

Engaging conversation with CWA Local 6215 members about the challenges young workers face in today's job market. Thank you Congressman Eric Swalwell for bringing #FutureForum and continuing this important conversation in the DFW Metroplex!

Speaker Paul Ryan, my colleagues and I call on you to denounce Rep. Steve King's disgraceful comments about America's increasing diversity. We are the People's House and that means fighting for all Americans - regardless of their religious beliefs, skin color, or background.

Seven years ago, President Barack Obama signed the Affordable Care Act into law. Since then millions of Americans from every state gained the peace of mind knowing that access to healthcare was not reserved for the wealthy few. It is beyond shameful that as we celebrate the millions of lives that were saved because of the ACA, House Republicans are actively working to shatter that progress. I will keep fighting to the very end to ensure that the GOP's healthcare "replacement" plan doesn't reek havoc on America's health. #ProtectOurCare

As House Republicans jam through a repeal to the Affordable Care Act that would take away health coverage to over 24 million people, I’ve been hearing directly from Texans that would face the uncertainty of maintaining their healthcare for themselves and their family. Time and time again, Republicans claim that their bill, “The American Health Care Act,” would ensure that many small business owners won’t have to close their doors and that individuals won’t affect their pocketbooks and will once again take charge of their health. Let me tell you, THAT is “fake news.” One resident from Dallas, Texas, Brandon, called to share his story on how this disastrous bill would affect him, his small business, and his family.  For years before the implementation of the Affordable Care Act, Brandon recalls his last and failed attempt to secure an individual health plan in 2008 as he was branded with a “pre-existing condition” because of an eye surgery he underwent years ago.  His wife, who was diagnosed with severe rheumatoid arthritis, has to take medication daily. Brandon shared that since enrolling into the marketplace in 2010 when the Affordable Care Act, he has been able to gain health coverage for himself and his wife. Most importantly, Brandon reaffirmed the promise of the Affordable Care Act, which allowed him to find an affordable plan that would allow him to keep his small business running and ensures that his wife can receive the medication she needs to live a normal life. Most importantly, Brandon confirmed that since enrolling during the last open enrollment, 2017 has been his best year of health and prescription coverage since the Affordable Care Act’s implementation. Brandon’s story is just one example of how millions of Americans HAVE taken control of their healthcare. Share your story on how the disastrous Republican plan would affect you and your family in the comment section below.

After 61 votes, seven years of promising to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, and a flurry of late night backroom deals, House Republicans still couldn’t come together to even vote on their terrible replacement plan. President Trump’s self-proclaimed master negotiation skills failed to deliver on the promises he made during the 2016 campaign. This ugly episode demonstrates that he is not a strong leader for Congressional Republicans. Seven years was more than enough time for different factions of the House Republican Caucus to create a viable replacement that actually delivers on their promises to lower costs and help Americans access better quality care. But instead, they tried to jam through a bill that alienated both moderate and right wing factions of their party. Luckily, their divided caucus allows the 20 million Americans who gained access to comprehensive health insurance under the Affordable Care Act to sleep peacefully, knowing that their health is not on the chopping block. #ProtectMyCare

Planned Parenthood of Greater Texas provides care every day in my community. They provide STI testing, cancer screenings, sex ed, and contraceptive counseling. I’m proud to #StandWithPP and fight for them because they provide quality health care to 2.5 million people every year across our country. #PinkOut

Texas ranks #26 in the nation for wage equality with women earning $79 cents for every dollar a man earns. I’m taking a stand against the wage gap this #EqualPayDay, because women aren’t second-class citizens. Their paychecks should reflect their contributions to our economy.

Join me and my staff for an open house at my new Fort Worth Office! Come stop by and check out the new office, ask questions, and learn about the services our office can provide to you. A FREE breakfast will be served.

Fort Worth, Texas - Join me tomorrow for my next Congress on Your Corner at Americado located 2000 W. Berry Street from 5-6:30 pm. This is your chance to discuss issues that are important to you and your community and how I can best represent you in our nation’s capital.

After a fair and thorough review, the court has again confirmed that the 2011 Texas Voter ID law was adopted with a discriminatory purpose in violation of the voting rights of Hispanic and African American Texans.  It is time for Governor Abbott and Texas Republican leaders to end their relentless effort to undermine the voting strength of minority Texans and to drop any intention of appealing the decision and spending more taxpayer funds defending overt discrimination. The ruling would not have been possible without the support of Texas citizens willing to fight back to protect our fundamental right to vote. I'm proud to stand with them and will continue to fight to ensure every Texan can participate fully and fairly in our elections.  https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/10/us/federal-judge-strikes-down-texas-voter-id-law.html?smprod=nytcore-ipad&smid=nytcore-ipad-share&_r=0
Fort Worth, Texas- I look forward to seeing you at Americado this evening from 5-6:30 for my Congress on Your Corner!

As of today, federal courts have ruled on SIX separate occasions since 2011 that Texas Republican leaders have intentionally discriminated against African-American and Latino voters. Three rulings in 2017 alone have affirmed that Republican leaders worked to dilute the voting strength of minorities from the local to federal level. Texans should not have to turn to the federal courts to assert their basic rights, but under Republican leadership, it has shamefully been their last line of defense. It’s time for Texas Republicans to finally quit wasting taxpayer money in defending their discriminatory crusade against the growing voting power of minorities and instead work to ensure that Texans of all backgrounds are represented fairly at the ballot box and can exercise their right to vote.  https://www.texastribune.org/2017/04/20/court-texas-house-map-intentionally-diluted-votes/
Good Morning Fort Worth, Texas! I'm here at Mrs. Renfro's Gourmet Salsa for my 'Marc Means Business' work day!

Before I start, Doug Renfro gives me a quick history lesson on Mrs. Renfro's Gourmet Salsa. Did you know that this Fort Worth company has been in business for over 77 years? I hope I learn the secret recipe to this thriving family-owned business!
Now it's time to really get to work! Pablo Soria, a 10 year employee with Mrs. Renfro's Gourmet Salsa, is showing me the ropes as we pull bulk ingredients for tomorrow's matches.
Safety first! Making sure I have my hair net and plastic sleeves on so I don't contaminate the spices as I begin the measuring portion here at Mrs. Renfro's Gourmet Salsa! #MMB

Each bag has a PRECISE amount of seasoning to create the dozens of Mrs. Renfro's Gourmet Salsa. Depending on the type of salsa, a  bag this size has enough seasoning to fill at least 145 jars! One down, only 19 to go! #MMB
Next duty, labeling the Hickory Smoked Barbeque Sauce for Mrs. Renfro's Gourmet Salsa. Trying my best to ensure the labels are placed correctly! #MMB
Now it's time to prep Mrs. Renfro's Gourmet Salsa products for nationwide distribution! #MMB

Yom HaShoah, Holocaust Remembrance Day, marks a day for all to remember the six million Jews and the millions of others murdered by the Nazis during the Holocaust. As a co-chair of the Bipartisan Task Force on Combating anti-Semitism, I stand in solidarity with our Jewish brothers and sisters and will continue to speak out against anti-Semitism in all forms to ensure the horrific events of the Holocaust are never forgotten. #HolocaustRemembranceDay

On Tuesday, April 24, 2017, I had the honor of awarding  Heavenly Najar, a freshman at Grand Prairie Fine Arts Academy, with this year’s top prize in the 33rd Congressional District 2017 Congressional Art Competition.  Heavenly’s piece, Bisabuela, was chosen as the overall winner. Over 50 students from schools across the DFW Metroplex participated in the 2017 art competition, including honorable mentions, in no particular order: Lizbeth Gutierrez, from Grand Prairie High School for Años de Casados, Carly Cawthon, from The Cambridge School of Dallas for Hope, and Paola Rivera from Grand Prairie Fine Arts Academy for Journey.
Immigrants are part of what make America great. They contribute their culture, their labor, their innovation, and a shared dream to provide their families a better life. #immigrantrights

I offer my thoughts and prayers to the Edwards family and the Balch Springs community after the shooting of 15-year-old Jordan Edwards; an incident that Police Chief Haber says “did not meet our core values.” It is more urgent than ever that Attorney General Sessions continue the Department of Justice’s support for community policing efforts. The Office of Community Policing has proven itself to be a crucial resource by providing additional training for our officers, enacting reform in police departments across the country, and building trust in communities. Any effort to defund the COPS (Community Oriented Policing Services) program would be severely misguided and a step backward in the gains we have made in repairing the relationships between communities and their police officers.

Today’s bipartisan bill represents an effort in good faith to pass a clean spending bill.  Many of the provisions included in the bill are a reflection of Democrats’ continued commitment to fight for all hardworking Americans while fighting back against poison pill amendments that are driven for partisan gain, including funding for President Trump’s unnecessary border wall and the defunding of Planned Parenthood.  One of the biggest wins for the American people is including funding that will continue to make it easier for students to achieve their higher education aspirations. This bill includes $22.5 billion for year-long funding to the Pell Grant program, which would boost the maximum Pell Grant award to nearly $6,000 per student. This boost in funding will ensure that students will now stay on track for graduation with less debt and guarantees that our future workforce has the tools they need to compete in the 21st-century global economy.   In addition to providing educational opportunities for our students, the bill also includes critical investments for a variety of federal agencies that President Trump threatened to eliminate in his budget plan. Democrats successfully secured $150 million for the National Endowment for the Arts and $150 million for the National Endowment for the Humanities, $34 billion for the National Institutes of Health and an advance appropriation of $445 million for the Corporation for Public Broadcasting for fiscal year 2019. The continued funding of these different agencies will allow students nationwide to gain access to the arts and expose low-income children to high-quality public programming that prepares them for success in the future.  When House Democrats and Republicans meet again in September to negotiate the next fiscal year’s spending bill, I hope that the same bipartisan spirit persists. Our country can’t afford to play games with our government and our President shouldn’t encourage House Republicans to hold necessary spending bills hostage to fund his costly and ineffective border wall.
For anyone in D.C. tomorrow, please join me and voting rights experts to discuss how recent voter ID victories in Texas, North Carolina, and Wisconsin will affect upcoming elections.
Voting rights experts discuss how recent voter ID victories in Texas, Wisconsin, and North Carolina affect the battle to restore access to the ballot box.
Voting rights experts discuss how recent voter ID victories in Texas, Wisconsin, and North Carolina affect the battle to restore access to the ballot box.
The GOP wants to take away healthcare from 24 million Americans. Affordable healthcare is a right!
NA

On the campaign trail, Trump promised to replace the Affordable Care Act with ‘something better,’ that would ‘lower costs,’ and protect individuals with pre-existing conditions. But with Trumpcare, Trump breaks his promise on healthcare and proves that House Republicans believe that partisan political gain is more important than the health of the communities they represent.   Trumpcare is a disaster for hardworking Americans who can expect to pay more for less coverage. It means that 24 million hard working Americans will be kicked off their health insurance plans. With the addition of the MacArthur and Upton amendments, Trumpcare becomes even more harmful to Americans. The amendment guts protections for individuals with preexisting conditions, removes requirements for coverage of essential healthcare benefits like maternity care, mental health treatment, and prescription drug coverage, and imposes an unlimited “age tax” on older Americans.    House Republicans cannot hide after voting in favor of this immoral and inhumane plan that will raise health costs for hardworking families. They must and will answer to the American people that voted them into office.

On Saturday, December 2, 2017, join me and Special Guest Rep. Linda Sánchez (CA-38), Vice Chair of the House Democrats, and expert panelists as we discuss how residents can best prepare for the President's dismantling of the DACA program and updates related to immigration.

The dishonestly named ‘Election Integrity Commission’ established by President Trump’s executive order last week is an extension of ongoing voter suppression.  Rather than enlighten and improve elections, it raises fears and doubts among voters.

Today’s Supreme Court decision makes it clear that Republicans in North Carolina, just like in my home state of Texas, engaged in an intentionally discriminatory #redistricting process that systematically packed and cracked minority neighborhoods in violation of the law. I am happy that North Carolina voters secured another victory against the national Republican crusade to undermine the voting power of African Americans and Hispanics in local, state, and federal elections.     https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/22/us/politics/supreme-court-north-carolina-congressional-districts.html

Thank you to all TX-33 residents who joined me at my 'May is Health and Fitness Month' events in Dallas and Fort Worth this month! From learning how to plant a home garden to gaining inspiration from NFLPlay60's high energy program, I hope everyone remains inspired to keep healthy living a top priority year-round!

Trump’s budget is a mob hit against hardworking American families. This budget represents yet another revoked campaign promise and makes President Trump’s millionaire cronies wealthier at the expense of hardworking families. By eliminating job training programs that would boost wages and job opportunities across America, Trump is turning his back on the blue collar Americans that elected him to the presidency.   Trump’s plan cruelly ransacks critical safety nets put in place to help American families who struggle to make ends meet or need additional assistance during times of unemployment.  The 2018 budget calls for $190 billion in cuts to the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and cuts the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) block grants by $15.6 billion. For the 33rd Congressional District of Texas, this budget means that over 52,000 DFW Metroplex households currently receiving SNAP benefits will not know when next meal will come.   A federal budget should be a testament to our nation’s values and priorities. President Trump apparently believes balancing the budget on the backs of hungry children, seniors, and our disabled is the American way. We must remind him that a strong national defense does not need to come at a price of leaving our most vulnerable out in the cold to fend for themselves. Our country is better served when it works in the interest of the people and not as an extension of Trump’s special interest mafia. #TrumpCuts  https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2017/05/22/trumps-plans-to-cut-food-stamps-could-hit-his-supporters-hardest/?utm_term=.198ed3e1ce1c

My 2017 D.C. Health and Fitness Expo is well under way! Join me and a range of orgs dedicated to making living a healthy lifestyle a little easier in the Rayburn Foyer until 3 PM today. You can even meet and play with field hockey Olympian Rachel Dawson! #MIHAFM17
George from @nationals just joined us in Rayburn Foyer. Hope he's ready to get his sweat on! #MIHAFM17

Today’s CBO score confirms the reckless damage House Republicans are willing to invoke on America’s sick, elderly, and working families to appease the radical wings of their party. By kicking 23 million Americans off their health insurance, shredding key protections, imposing a crushing age tax on our seniors, and ransacking Medicare, it is clear that any lip service paid to improving our nation’s healthcare system was just that – all talk.  Americans with pre-existing conditions will once again have to fight to obtain coverage. The return of high-risk pools will force sick Americans to pay outlandish premiums while imposing lifetime limits on the care they need. Additionally, House Republicans’ pitiful $8 billion in funding for high-risk pools is merely a drop in the bucket and fails to meaningfully offset the costs of insuring America’s less healthy.  Each page of the CBO score delivers bad news for the millions of Americans who have gained access to health insurance for the first time and for those who now have better coverage as a result of the Affordable Care Act. House Republicans must now hold their head high and wear the scarlet letter they’ve earned. #Trumpcare  https://mobile.nytimes.com/2017/05/24/us/politics/cbo-congressional-budget-office-health-care.html?_r=0&referer=https://www.google.com/

It's always an honor to meet TX-33 residents who have faithfully served our country. Today, I presented a flag flown over the U.S. Capitol to Michael Ayala for his service as a member of the Merchant Marines during World War II and his four-decade long career as part of the U.S. Postal Service. As we approach Memorial Day and remember the fallen, I urge you all to honor those who have served and those who paid the ultimate price in the name of our freedom.
Today we pause to remember the brave men and women who paid the ultimate sacrifice protecting our freedoms. #MemorialDay

Homeownership is a pillar of the American dream and a goal that should not be out of reach for our nation’s veterans. This is a sad day for all of us. It is horrifying to think that someone would target Members of Congress as they were practicing for a charity baseball game aimed at fostering a spirit of bipartisanship and sportsmanship. My thoughts and prayers remain with Congressman Steve Scalise, the injured Congressional staffers, my colleagues on the field, the Capitol Police, and first responders who sprang into action to protect all those affected.   http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/14/532894023/gunman-opens-fire-as-members-of-congress-practice-baseball

Going live on Tucker Carlson Tonight with Senator Jeff Flake to discuss how today's shooting at the Congressional baseball game practice has shaken all on Capitol Hill. An attack on one is an attack on all.

As we gather in remembrance of Juneteenth, it is more important than ever that we share with the next generation the significance of today's celebration. It is only when we reflect on our history that we can truly build a better tomorrow. Happy Juneteenth!

Yesterday was #WorldRefugeeDay and I had the opportunity to share Bothina Matar's family's story that reminds us why it is more important than ever that the United States doubles down on its global leadership and sends a clear message of support for efforts to protect the most vulnerable populations among us.
Joining House Democrats at 10:30 AM ET to discuss the state of #votingrights. Tune in via Livestream! #CVRC #VRA

After comparing House Republicans’ healthcare plan with the one unveiled in the Senate, it’s obvious that Republicans in both chambers are attempting to disguise a cruel bill full of tax breaks for the wealthy as healthcare reform. There is no mention of anything that would actually help the average working American afford quality health insurance. Similar to the drafting process House Republicans followed, GOP Senators worked on the bill behind closed doors and with no input from the industries they aim to reform or from patients or their advocates.     Don’t let the Senate bill fool you. This is still a bad bill. Kicking millions of Americans off health insurance, shredding key protections, cutting off access to crucial family planning, imposing a crushing age tax on our seniors, and ransacking Medicare doesn’t sound like the makings of a better healthcare system. Republicans in both chambers need to refocus their energy and take the time to craft legislation that provides quality care for a reasonable price. A lack of consideration and a rushed process has resulted in a bill where Americans are stuck paying more for less. #Trumpcare  https://www.nytimes.com/2017/06/22/us/politics/senate-health-care-bill.html

The Senate could possibly vote this week to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act with a bill that will strip millions of Americans of their healthcare, remove key protections for those with pre-existing conditions, impose a crushing age tax on our seniors, and create unnecessary barriers to reproductive health services. That it is why everyone needs to look past the headlines about #Trumpcare and realize that changes to our health care system affect everyone. I want to hear from all of you about how your life has improved under the Affordable Care Act so that Republican Senators know exactly who they are hurting when they vote this week.
The Medicaid gap has caused unnecessary suffering for Texans across the state and #Trumpcare is set to make it even worse.

No matter which why you look at it, Senate Republicans’ health care replacement is just as a bad as the version that was passed in the House last month. Today’s CBO score confirms that 22 million Americans will lose health care coverage and premiums will not significantly decrease as Republicans promised. Instead, working families will have to dedicate more of their hard earned paycheck to cover medical expenses and seniors will pay a crushing age tax. Scaling back Medicaid as Senate Republicans propose will hurt everyone including the 64% of seniors who rely on the program to cover their nursing home expenses. The sobering report from the CBO should shame Senate Republicans who are obviously willing to put the American people at risk in exchange for deep tax cuts for the extremely wealthy.   Your health matters. Your stories matter.

#Trumpcare will affect everyone and it's our job to show Senate Republicans who they are turning their back on when they vote to replace the Affordable Care Act with tax cuts for the extremely wealthy.
I was proud to stand with my Future Forum colleagues and make clear that #Trumpcare spells disaster for millennials who are already facing tough financial decisions. #MyHealthMyFuture

Busy day already! First served as ranking member on Committee on Science, Space, & Technology - Democrats' Energy Subcommittee for a hearing on material science research and now a marathon all day, all night markup of FY18 National Defense Authorization Act is about to start. Tune in  to see how House Armed Services Committee Democrats and House Armed Services Committee Republicans work together to define our country's military priorities for the coming year.

House Republicans are taking a page out of Texas Republicans’ despicable anti-immigrant agenda. Like #SB4, HR 3003 and 3004 aim to punish local law enforcement that would rather prioritize building trust in their communities than take on additional responsibilities that should fall on the federal government. Instead of addressing the reforms our immigration system desperately needs, House Republicans are seeking to further criminalize immigrants who interact with law enforcement even due to the most minor infractions. Our current laws already punish unauthorized immigrants who commit crimes and try to re-enter the country. Continuing to perpetuate the myth that immigrants commit crimes at a higher rate than native-born citizens is simply not based in facts. House Republicans cannot continue offering ‘enforcement only’ policies as the sole solution to our nation’s broken immigration system, especially when those tactics justify racial profiling.

America was built on the backs of immigrants who left their home countries with the dream of building a better life for their families. Today, now more than ever, we must affirm our support for the immigrant community especially as they continue to be criminalized by laws like yesterday's  'sanctuary cities' bills and #SB4. Immigrants bring their culture and work ethic to build a better America for everyone. That is why I am proud to say my staff and #IStandWithImmigrants

How does President Trump's "Election Integrity" Commission's access to the voting history, party affiliation, and address of every voter across the country help uncover alleged "voter fraud"? Frankly, it doesn't. Access to such sensitive information will only further empower those who wish to take voter suppression to a frightening new level. #votingrights
My July #MMB at Big State Fountain Grill  begins with washing dishes before the big lunch rush #TX33
Bussing tables to keep the lunch crowd moving on in. #MMB #TX33

Just days after the Trump Election Integrity Commission’s cynical effort to obtain personal information of voters across the country, it’s alarming that the Trump Department of Justice has switched sides in the Texas Voter ID case and is now defending intentional discrimination by Texas Republican leaders.  The Department of Justice is empowered and expected to defend voting rights and protect all American voters.  The Department’s move in Texas, however, signals that they are abandoning their responsibility to uphold basic voting rights to join forces with those who dilute and suppress participation in our elections.  Time and again, the federal courts have confirmed that the 2011 Texas Voter ID law discriminates against minority voters.  Despite the opposition of our own Justice Department, I am proud to be a lead plaintiff in the lawsuit challenging the discriminatory Texas Voter ID law and remain confident that the protections within the Voting Rights Act and our Constitution will ultimately prevail. #votingrights  http://thehill.com/homenews/news/340882-justice-department-asks-federal-court-not-to-challenge-texas-voter-id-law

The internet’s greatest asset of interconnectedness is also its greatest vulnerability. That is why I submitted an amendment to the Fiscal Year 2018 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) requiring the Department of Defense to study of our nation’s cybersecurity needs. While it won’t be included in this year’s bill, it is more urgent than ever that we identify current vulnerabilities. Our national security, economy, and way of life will depend on it.

Bringing jobs to #TX33 remains one of my top priorities as your member of Congress. That is why I am excited to announce that Lockheed Martin is hiring and will be interviewing applicants ON-SITE at the Sheraton Fort Worth Downtown Hotel starting at 7 A.M tomorrow, July 18. If you have any experience with manufacturing, engineering, finance or supply chains, you might be a good fit for the open positions.

Despite our President and Republicans’ obsession with “widespread voter fraud,” the voter fraud myth has been debunked by various reputable research organizations, including the ACLU, The Brennan Center, Campaign Legal Center, and the PEW Research Center to name a few. The President’s "Advisory Commission on Election Integrity" ignores these findings and is instead led by members like Kris Kobach and others who are notorious for advocating for laws aimed at suppressing the vote. I will be joining my Congressional Black Caucus colleagues at 3 PM EST to lift the veil on the Commission's true purpose and hear from actual experts who know that voter suppression is the real issue Congress must address. #votingrights  LIVE STREAM SHARED BELOW ↓

Proud of these kids who are already taking the steps to stay healthy and active at today's Youth Sports Expo!

Hmmm ... it looks like President Trump's "Art of the Deal" negotiation skills weren't as effective after all. It's time for a real jobs bill! President Trump needs to pay attention to jobs and less on Twitter.

Great meeting with AFL-CIO President Richard Trumka and members of the Blue Collar Caucus on the ways Democrats can make it clear that we will fight tooth and nail for livable wages, pensions, and education so blue collar workers know we are the ones on their side. #bluecollar #bluecollarcaucus #jobs #fightingforamerica #madeinamerica #makeitamerica #jobsjobsjobs

I represent the single highest uninsured Congressional district in the entire country. With rumors that Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell may try to force a full repeal vote on the Affordable Care Act as early as tomorrow, I have to highlight again the damage repealing the ACA will cause for thousands of families in my district who already struggle to pay for a routine check-up. Texas Republicans did nothing to alleviate this problem when they discouraged Governor Abbott to refuse Medicaid expansion that would have extended care to thousands of Texans. The Affordable Care Act isn't perfect, but it's time that both sides of the aisle come together and work on a bipartisan fix that works for all Americans.

As a member of the Armed Services Committee, I am appalled that the President of the United States would blatantly abandon any American who is willing to lay down their life to defend their fellow citizens.  By prohibiting qualified Americans from serving their country, the President is backtracking on his campaign promise to protect the LGBT community and reduces the pool of capable candidates who volunteer to serve their country. It’s an insult to the transgender community and to our military.

As if Republicans' tireless crusade to strip health care from 22-32 million Americans isn't enough to make your blood boil, the Trump Administration suddenly cut grant funds for effective sex-education programs that help young people plan for their futures. I have one question for our President: Why is the Trump Administration setting up young men and women to fail?   Thank you to Teen Vogue for helping me highlight this important issue!

So proud of my former intern Erin Ayan Gaddis for being part of the winning team at the first NAACP-ShortsTV US “Documenting Justice” Competition. Her short documentary, "JustUs: Living With a Criminal Record" explored how art can be used as rehabilitation for formerly incarcerated people and the types of support systems they need to successfully reintegrate into society.

It's young people like Jovahana that give me hope for the future of our country. Jovahana is an Oak Cliff native and a first-generation college student starting her junior year at St. Edward's University this fall. I was impressed with her passion about development issues in Oak Cliff and dedication to public service. I can't wait to see what she does in the future.

Health care, bringing back jobs to the DFW Metroplex, and immigration have all been in the headlines recently. I want to hear your thoughts and how Congress can address the issues affecting our community once we return in September. Fort Worth, Texas, I'll be joining your commute on the Fort Worth Transportation Authority (The T) this Monday morning starting at 7:30 AM, so please feel free to stop me to chat face-to-face.

I have the privilege of representing the DFW Metroplex in Congress and chatting face to face with constituents is what motivates me to work on your behalf every day. During my 'Congress On Your Commute' this morning on Fort Worth's T Route #28 I discussed obstacles our veterans face and how the flow of jobs to North Texas is bringing folks from all over to Texas' 33rd.

For those who RSVP'd to today's grant writing workshop, I look forward to seeing you at 10 AM at John Dubiski Career High School (2900 State Hwy 161, Grand Prairie, 75051) so you can learn how to access the resources you need to make our community better for all.

As your federal representative, I am always searching for ways to connect more federal resources to the DFW Metroplex. Thank you to the 400+ #TX33 residents that joined me for my 2017 Grant Workshop earlier this week.

Fifty two years ago, President Johnson signed the original Voting Rights Act ensuring for the first time that every American citizens had unfettered access to the ballot box. Today, we are fighting for the heart of our democracy as states across the country are once again implementing voter suppression laws (like restrictive voter ID laws) in light of a weakened VRA. We must fight to restore the VRA to reflect today's civil rights needs and ensure that our democracy can continue to thrive.

Texas Republicans refuse to end their crusade against women's access to reproductive care. Their latest ploy requesting a Medicaid section 1115 waiver for the state's "Healthy Texas Women" family planning program aims to block organizations like Planned Parenthood from participating and undermines birth control access for teenagers.   Not only does the state's waiver violate federal law, which allows Medicaid beneficiaries to choose any qualified provider for their medical needs, but it puts reproductive care further out of reach for the low-income women who depend on critical services provided at family planning centers. That is why Congresswoman Eddie Bernice Johnson, Congressman Beto O'Rourke, Congresswoman Louise Slaughter, Congresswoman Diana DeGette, Congresswoman Jan Schakowsky and I led 105 Democrats in a letter urging the Trump Administration to reject Texas' proposal and refuse to set a dangerous precedent for other anti-choice states to follow.

Each April, I host a Teen Summit & Job Fair to help prepare #TX33 high school students for success after graduation. As part of this effort, I bring together local employers hiring for summer jobs and internships. Yesterday, Sylvia Gonzalez and Alexis Lopez, two Dallas ISD Sunset High School graduates hired at the 2017 Teen Summit, shadowed me for the afternoon as part of their AT&T internship. In between the visit to the Dallas Holocaust Museum and a tour of TKO Machinery, Sylvia and Alexis shared how their internship at AT&T opened their eyes to different roles at the company. Connecting young people with the resources available in our community is a major part of empowering the next generation. And nothing beats witnessing young people who are excited about their future.

Democracy works best when I hear directly from you. Please join me this Tuesday (8/15) at the Anita  Martinez Recreation Center in Dallas or Thursday (8/17) at the Tarrant County College Opportunity Center in Fort Worth from 6 - 7:30 P.M. for an opportunity to share your thoughts and concerns about the issues that affect you and your family. Hope to see you there!

Dallas, Texas--It's not too late to RSVP for my Dallas town hall tonight. Join me from 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM at the Anita Martinez Recreation Center for your chance to speak to me face-to-face about the issues that matter to you and your family.

After six years of legal battles and millions of taxpayer dollars wasted by Texas Republican leadership, the courts once again ruled against Texas’ discriminatory congressional maps. The decision by the San Antonio district court will ensure that more Texans have an equal opportunity to elect the candidate of their choice and that Texas’ political maps will more accurately reflect the voting power of African Americans and Hispanics in local, state, and federal elections.     For years, Texas Republican leadership has robbed Texans of their voice and rightful representation in the halls of Congress. After years of discrimination against minority Texans, the court was generous to allow the Texas legislature the ability to submit new maps that adhere to the courts’ findings. It is my hope that legislative leaders do not waste this opportunity and finally reverse course on their record of intentional discrimination against Texas voters. I have the distinct honor of representing the 33rd Congressional District of Texas and I’m proud of what we’ve accomplished together. #VotingRights https://www.texastribune.org/2017/08/15/federal-court-invalidates-part-texas-congressional-map/

Having an open and honest dialogue is important to ensure I’m doing my best to represent the DFW Metroplex in Congress. Thank you to the #TX33 residents that joined me at last night’s town hall in Dallas, Texas​. Couldn’t make it out last night? Tomorrow is your next chance to join me at my Fort Worth, Texas Town Hall​ to share your thoughts on healthcare, immigration, national security, and how President Trump’s actions affect you and your community. Hope to see you there!

Today's #MMB was a lot of hard work and I appreciate the team of A&T Landscaping LLC. for sharing their day with me. #MarcMeansBusiness #FortWorth

Time and time again, our federal courts have ruled that the Texas voter ID law intentionally discriminates against Texas citizens in violation of the Voting Rights Act and the U.S. Constitution. As the lead plaintiff in Veasey v. Abbott, I am proud that we have so far successfully challenged and blocked these illegal efforts to restrict voting.  It is time for Texas Republican leaders to end shameful efforts to hold power through voter suppression. #votingrights  https://www.texastribune.org/2017/08/23/federal-judge-tosses-new-texas-voter-id-law/

Please join me on September 18th for my first senior seminar at the Primrose Oaks Senior Apartments to learn about local resources aimed to keep you healthy, safe, and financially secure as you enter retirement. For more information, please visit veasey.house.gov.

Any adjustment to the DACA program before fully protecting thousands of hardworking immigrants will be a betrayal to the promise we made to these bright young people in 2012. My House Republican colleagues must unite with my fellow Democrats to pass the DREAM act to give piece of mind to over 800,000 DACA-mented youth and prevent the unnecessary separation of families trying to achieve the American Dream.

Natural disasters do not discriminate. They can strike any zip code. I am proud that the entire Texas delegation stands united to help our fellow Texans and ensure Congress provides them the resources they need to rebuild and recover after Hurricane Harvey. #TexasStrong #HurricaneHarvey
Thousands of young Dreamers are relying on Congress to finally provide a permanent solution and pass the DREAM Act. It's time to get to work and get this done!

It isn't every day that a Fort Worth, Texas living legend is inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame. I was humbled to honor the legendary Coach Robert Hughes as he is recognized for his immense contributions to the Texas basketball community. Coach Hughes' unmatched ability to translate his love for the sport to the boys he coached and shaped into productive young men will now be rightfully recognized and Fort Worth couldn't be more proud. Congrats Coach Hughes!

Sixteen years ago, the fabric of our nation was tested. Since then, we proved that united we stand, divided we fall. Today, we remember the victims of the 9/11 attacks on the Twin Towers, the Pentagon, and United Airlines Flight 93 as well as the thousands of first responders and everyday heroes who risked their lives during America's darkest hours.

Nearly 150,000 #DACA recipients call #Texas home and our state has a lot to lose if they are suddenly removed from the workforce or can no longer pursue higher education. Tomorrow, tune in here from 4:00 - 4:30 CT as my fellow Texas Democrats and I discuss how terminating DACA without offering a permanent legislative fix will break apart Texas families and devastate our economy.

According to a recent Morning Consult/ POLITICO poll, 58 percent of Americans believe that DREAMers should remain in the only country they've ever called home. Tune in here at 5 PM EST as my fellow Texas Dems discuss what our state stands to lose if we turn our back on these bright young people.

Tune in at 4 PM CT as I am joined by my Texas Democratic colleagues to discuss how we remain committed to passing the DREAM Act and work towards giving DACA recipients the peace of mind they deserve. If you have questions. please share them in the comment section once the conversation goes live in an hour.
Join Texas Dems as we discuss the ways ending the DACA program without a long term legislative fix will hurt our state for years to come. #DefendDACA

America was built on the backs of immigrants. We can't turn our backs on the latest generation of immigrants. DREAMers are our family, friends, and neighbors. It's time Congress pass the #DREAMAct and allow these young people to reach their full potential.

Our nation's seniors deserve respect and dignity as they enter retirement. It has been over a week since Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands were hit by the catastrophic power of Hurricanes Maria and Irma. Citizens of Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands please know that #Texas stands with you and will work to ensure you have the same level of support our state received during our time of need.

No matter which way Senate GOP tried to dress it up, #GrahamCassidy snatched health care from millions, stripped crucial protections for Americans with pre-existing conditions, and would raise health insurance costs around the country.

Last night's Department of Homeland Security decision to not extend TPS status for Nicaragua will have disastrous effects for their families and the communities that depend on them. These are individuals who are working and contributing to their local communities, they are business owners and mortgage holders who’ve been put through extensive background checks every 18 months since they’ve arrived. Congress must act and #SaveTPS to ensure families aren't unnecessarily torn apart.

Join me on Veteran’s Day, Friday, November 10th, 2017, as we honor the 33rd District's 2017 Congressional Veterans Commendation Awardees alongside special guest, State Senator Royce West and stay for the Veterans' Town Hall. Hearing from the 33rd Congressional District residents is crucial to helping me do a better job in Washington, D.C. I hope you can join me on Friday.

This week I was proud to welcome Tricia Hiros, Principal Engineer for Manufacturing Projects for Bell Helicopter & Skills Committee Chair for DFW Aerospace Consortium, to D.C. as my guest for the first House Democratic Caucus Access to Jobs Task Force's stakeholder discussion.   As a co-chair of the task force, I wanted to make sure that a major DFW Metroplex employer was recognized for their efforts to encourage more TX-33 students to pursue careers in advanced manufacturing. I look forward to continuing these conversations with my colleagues and experts on jobs, education, and vocational training to discuss how Democrats can further promote commonsense policies that benefit working men and women in America.

Thank you to NAACP Legal Defense Fund MALDEF CAIR Asian American Legal Defense and Education Fund (AALDEF) and NALEO Educational Fund for sharing your expertise and urging Congress to update the Voting Rights Act to prevent the current wave of voter suppression aimed at traditionally marginalized voters. I remain committed to protecting the right to vote for all Americans.

Today and every day we are reminded of the extraordinary sacrifices our men and women in uniform have made to ensure the freedom of our nation’s democracy. The 33rd Congressional District of Texas is home to over 18,000 American veterans and I renew my promise to ensure each of you are treated with the upmost dignity and respect for your selfless service to our nation.  Thank you to all of our nation’s veterans, active military and military families. We are forever grateful for your service and sacrifice.

We owe it to our veterans to not just thank them for their service once a year, but honor them year round by ensuring they receive the care they need rightfully earned and deserve. Today, as you thank all those who have faithfully served in our military, I would also keep in mind all the improvements we need to make to ensure the government fulfills its commitments to our veterans. I am proud to work alongside colleagues like Congressman Beto O'Rourke and Congressman Seth Moulton to improve the level care our veterans receive in the United States.

The countdown for my FREE job fair is officially on! FOUR DAYS REMAIN until the 5th Annual 33rd Congressional District Job Fair and you don’t want to miss out on this highly anticipated event on Friday, November 17 at Tarrant County College South Campus Gymnasium!   Over 70 companies will be joining me to meet job seekers just like YOU! Pre-registration is highly encouraged, RSVP today: http://bit.ly/2ADpxpl

Last night, I filed an amendment to the #GOPTaxScam bill that adds provisions to support the working class by strengthening families, assisting immigrants who want to become patriotic Americans, and incentivizing greater access to fresh, healthy food.  I am disappointed that Speaker Paul Ryan and the House Republicans will likely not allow the amendment to come up for a vote, but not surprised. Speaker Ryan recently broke the record for the most “closed rules” in a session, and has not allowed a bill to come to the floor under an open process since he took the gavel two years ago.

Just as I predicted, House Republicans refused to allow any Democratic amendments to their #GOPTaxScam bill.  House Republican Leadership simply wouldn't allow it to be even considered for debate. Instead, they closed the process and are permitting just 4 hours of debate for a bill that would touch every sector of the U.S. economy. This is not how you move bipartisan tax reform forward and not how you help working families.

Companies like: Alcon, Lockheed Martin, American Airlines, Martin Sprocket & Gear, Inc., PepsiCo, Frito-Lay, Bell Helicopter, Southwest Airlines, and MoneyGram are just a few of the 75+ companies looking to hire someone like YOU at my 5th Annual Job Fair this Friday, November 17!  Learn more about the companies actively hiring right here in the DFW Metroplex and RSVP today: http://bit.ly/2ADpxpl.

Blue collar workers are the backbone of our economy, but their efforts haven't been rewarded even as corporate profits have skyrocketed. That is why I’m proud to co-sponsor the Patriot Employer Act alongside Blue Collar Caucus Co-chair Congressman Brendan Boyle and Blue Collar Caucus member Congresswoman Jan Schakowsky that rewards companies who keep good-paying jobs right here at home.   This is the #betterdeal hardworking families need, not the #GOPTaxScam we are set to vote on today that would tack on an expiration date for tax cuts for individuals while making big breaks for giant corporations permanent.

House Democrats are working hard to ensure that the thousands of young immigrants who stepped out of the shadows to work and study are not left out in the cold. Join the conversation this Saturday, December 2nd at Northside Community Center in Fort Worth for my DACA Summit and Immigration Town Hall to share why you believe Congress must pass the #DREAMAct and how the DACA program has benefitted our home state.

As the holiday season approaches, I want to thank Foundation for Advancing Alcohol Responsibility for their continued work to prevent drunk driving and underage drinking. I am honored to receive a 2017 Leadership Award winner for my work to prevent impaired driving and underage drinking at my annual D.C. health fair. It’s important for our community, especially parents, to educate our children on the importance of how to stay safe and responsible by not giving into peer pressure.

For anyone who has ever enjoyed the Forest Hill Public Library, you can thank Jerline Harvey for her tireless efforts to establish the city's first library. Today, I honored Jerline for her life of service to the Forest Hill community. You will be dearly missed.

As the #immigration debate continues in the halls of Congress and across the nation, join me TOMORROW, Saturday, December 2nd with Special Guest Rep. Linda Sánchez (CA-38), Vice Chair of the House Democrats, and expert panelists as we discuss how residents can best prepare for the President's changes to DACA program and updates related to immigration.

This is the last week you can sign up for affordable health care 2018 coverage for you and your family. Start the new year with peace of mind knowing your family can stay healthy and get the care they need.

Not sure how to sign up for health insurance online through healthcare.gov? Don't worry. It's a lot easier than you think and you may even qualify for financial assistance ensuring your family is taken care of in 2018.

Did you sign up for healthcare coverage last year and would like to keep your same health insurance in 2018? Or has your family's needs changed and you'd like to shop around and see what other health care plans are available in your state? Visit healthcare.gov and follow these easy steps to stay covered in the new year. Deadline to sign up or switch plans is December 15th!

Manufacturing jobs are returning to the U.S., after a decade of declining numbers. But employers are struggling to find qualified candidates.  That is why I am proud to serve as a co-chair of the Blue Collar Caucus and the Jobs for America Task Force to support crucial apprenticeship programs that prepare young people to take advantage of good-paying jobs in the manufacturing sector.
As sundown marks the first night of #Hanukkah, I want to wish all who celebrate a very happy holiday!

Republicans have made it clear who they had in mind when they created their #GOPTaxScam and it wasn't working families. Their choice to eliminate the medical tax deduction hurts families paying for high healthcare costs for themselves and their loved ones. #NotOnePenny

My last #MMB of 2017 has me helping behind the scenes at @texastheatre as Star Wars: The Last Jedi premieres today. First job for me is working the concession stand making sure movie patrons get all the snacks they need.
Next up is cleaning up the theatre and restocking the candy for the 4 PM showing of #StarWars #MMB  @ Texas Theatre

Today's vote on the #GOPTaxScam makes it clear that the billionaire wish list has been met. Today’s Republican tax bill helps the wealthiest families avoid paying their fair share of taxes, slashes the corporate tax rate in half, unfairly shifts the burden of taxes onto hardworking Americans living paycheck to paycheck, and keeps loopholes that allow corporations to ship jobs overseas.  The tax cuts will explode the deficit by $1.5 trillion which will translate to Republicans justifying devastating cuts to the programs Americans rely on to stay healthy and take care of themselves as they enter retirement. Medicaid, Medicare, SNAP, and Social Security will all be put on the chopping block in order to give away tax cuts to the wealthiest Americans.  While Republicans may be celebrating today’s tax cuts for the wealthy as a victory, the effects of their deceptive tax scam will be felt by the Americans who need the most help.

I had the opportunity to honor the life of  GPHSGophers Principal Lorimer Arendse who lost his battle with stage four lung cancer. My thoughts and prayers are with the Arendse Family, the Gopher community, and all those who had the opportunity to know him.
